skill.name: Skill Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user wants to "create a skill", "add a skill to plugin", "write a new skill", "improve skill description", "organize skill content", or needs guidance on skill structure, progressive disclosure, or skill development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

security_audit.summary: Official skill content with documentation and guidance only. No executable scripts, network access, or filesystem operations in this directory.

content.user_title: Build a plugin skill with clear structure
content.value_statement: Creating a new skill for Claude Code requires understanding the skill anatomy, progressive disclosure, and writing conventions. This skill provides step-by-step guidance, validation rules, and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Explain required skill folder structure with SKILL.md, references, examples, and scripts directories
Provide a step-by-step skill creation workflow for plugin development
Define frontmatter rules including third-person trigger phrases and description format
Detail progressive disclosure principles for file organization and content placement
Offer a validation checklist to verify skill quality before release
limitations: Does not automatically create or validate skill files
Does not generate SKILL.md content or templates
No integration with external build tools or CI/CD
Does not test skills in a running Claude Code environment

use_cases.title: Create a new skill
use_cases.description: Follow the step sequence to design and structure a new skill for a plugin with proper folder layout.

use_cases.title: Improve skill clarity
use_cases.description: Refine SKILL.md wording, triggers, and organization for better activation and context management.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill setup
use_cases.description: Apply a shared validation checklist and progressive disclosure rules across all team skills.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Need structure for a new plugin skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill outline for a Claude Code plugin. Include frontmatter triggers, folders, and a brief SKILL.md structure.

prompt_templates.title: Improve triggers
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill description and propose stronger trigger phrases in third person format. Keep the description concise.

prompt_templates.title: Plan resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Given these example tasks, list which scripts, references, and assets should be added to the skill and why.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this SKILL.md against the validation checklist. List missing items and suggest improvements.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill for plugin hooks and keep it lean.
output: Define trigger phrases in third person frontmatter
Keep SKILL.md focused on core procedures
Move detailed patterns to references files
Add scripts only for repeatable tasks

best_practices: Use specific trigger phrases in third person frontmatter format
Keep SKILL.md lean and move detailed content to references
Include a validation checklist before skill release
anti_patterns: Write second person instructions in SKILL.md body
Place all details in a single large SKILL.md file
Omit references to supporting files in references directory

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code plugins?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is written specifically for Claude Code plugin skills and their folder structure.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run scripts, create files, or validate automatically.

faq.question: How do I integrate it into my plugin?
faq.answer: Place the skill folder under your plugin skills directory and ensure SKILL.md is present.

faq.question: Does it handle my data safely?
faq.answer: It is static guidance content and does not transmit, store, or process any user data.

faq.question: What if the skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Review trigger phrases in frontmatter and ensure the description uses third person wording.

faq.question: How does it compare to other skill guides?
faq.answer: It is tailored to Claude Code plugins and emphasizes progressive disclosure design.
